articles.title: Greetings to Mexican President
articles.content:
Greetings to Mexican President 
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto on the occasion of the 205th anniversary of its independence. 
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing the Mexican president and people bigger successes in their work for stability and development of the country.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Bangladeshi Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Bangladeshi Ambassador 
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong had a talk with new Bangladeshi Ambassador to the DPRK M. Fazlul Karim who paid a courtesy call on him on Wednesday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Bangladeshi Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Bangladeshi Ambassador 
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Bangladeshi Ambassador to the DPRK M. Fazlul Karim at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: Moves to Railroad "Bill on Human Rights in North" through NA under Fire
articles.content:
Moves to Railroad "Bill on Human Rights in North" through NA under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) Wednesday issued a statement assailing the ruling and opposition parties of south Korea for working hard to railroad the "bill on human rights in the north" through the "National Assembly" (NA) at any cost, claiming that they agreed on the main provisions of it recently.
					 The conservative forces of south Korea including the "Saenuri Party" are talking volumes about "possibility" of the passage of the "bill on human rights in the north" which has been left miscarried at the NA for the past more than a decade while opposition parties are justifying their base collusion, asserting that "human rights are universally accepted value of human beings " and "crying out for protection and promotion of human rights in the north."
					
					 The CPRK vehemently denounces the ruling and opposition parties and anti-reunification conservative forces of south Korea for their moves to pass the "bill" through the NA, terming them an outrageous politically-motivated provocation and undisguised declaration of confrontation of social system, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The south Korean NA is working hard to railroad the "bill" at a time when the U.S. and its followers are kicking up a "human rights" racket against the DPRK in the international arena including the UN. This is a despicable crime of leaving the destiny of the nation to the tender mercy of foreign forces.
					
					 It is quite natural that the south Korean people are refuting and opposing the moves to make the "bill" a law as a foolish act of driving the inter-Korean relations into catastrophe quite contrary to the trend toward dialogue and the improvement of relations growing strong thanks to the inter-Korean agreement.
					
					 What is stunning the public is that the NA is talking about "inter-Korean parliamentary talks" while crying out for the carriage of the "bill" for confrontation.
					
					 It is preposterous to talk about "implementation of the agreement," "improved relations" and "dialogue" while categorically negating and opposing the dialogue partner. This behavior is no more than clumsy red herring of those with ulterior motive.
					
					 If the south Korean politicians have a reason, they had better face up to the reality of the DPRK where the people enjoy a worthy life, stop reckless tongue-lashing and mind their own business in the world's worst  tundra of human rights..
					
					 The DPRK has already declared that it would resolutely counter the moves to pass the "bill" and "human rights" racket against it, regarding them as a declaration of a war against it.
					
					 It remains unchanged in its resolute stand never to pardon those who try to infringe upon its dignity and sovereignty.

articles.title: Co-Chairman of Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation Council Arrives
articles.content:
Co-Chairman of Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation Council Arrives 
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Johnny Hon, co-chairman of the Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation, arrived here on Wednesday.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il 
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Johnny Hon, co-chairman of the Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation, Wednesday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill. 
					 He laid a bouquet before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Reception Given by ASEAN Committee in DPRK
articles.content:
Reception Given by ASEAN Committee in DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The ASEAN Committee in the DPRK hosted a reception on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 Present there on invitation were DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong, Vice-Minister of External Economic Relations Ri Myong San, Vice-Chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries So Ho Won and other officials concerned. 
					
					 Present at the reception were Bambang Hiendrasto, Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK and chairman of the ASEAN Committee here; Op Sisawada, Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK; Pham Viet Hung, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK; Phonekham Inthaboualy, Lao ambassador to the DPRK; Mohammad Nizan Bin Mohammad, Malaysian ambassador to the DPRK; Op Sisawada, Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK; and Pham Viet Hung, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK. 
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Youth League Art Squad Gives Performances Everyday
articles.content:
Youth League Art Squad Gives Performance Every Day 
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The Art Squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League is giving the performance "Song of Youth Following the Sun" at the Youth Park Open-Air Theatre every day. 
					 The performance begins with small choruses "Song of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League" and "Joy of the People." Put on the stage are diverse numbers including male quintet guitar ensemble "Our Future Is Bright," agitation and solo performance "Youth Revolutionary School" and comic story "Name of Youth." 
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who always regarded attaching importance to the youth as the most important affair of the Korean revolution and laid an eternal foundation for building the power of the youth. 
					
					 They represented the indomitable will, courage, ardent enthusiasm and optimism of young vanguard vigorously advancing with the dream and ideal of youth in the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu, true to the call of the party and the leader. 
					
					 The performance fully demonstrated the faith and will of the five million members of the young vanguard to glorify forever the idea of the great leaders on the youth movement and their exploits and dynamically advance for the final victory, united close around Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Construction of Sci-Tech Complex Nears Completion
articles.content:
Construction of Sci-Tech Complex Nears Completion
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- It has been pushed forward at the final stage in Pyongyang, the DPRK to furnish indoor exhibition halls and outdoor exhibition grounds of the Sci-Tech Complex.
					 The exhibition places would help visitors get comprehensive knowledge of general scientific and technological principles and development of science and technology with various kinds of exhibits.
					
					 Among indoor exhibition halls are dream hall for children, laboratory for virtual experimentation and wing for scientific research.
					
					 Scientists and technicians have developed a multi-functional information service system of high effectiveness.

articles.title: U.S. to Blame for Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. to Blame for Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, U.S. Secretary of Defense Carter said at video dialogue with GIs all over the world that the Korean Peninsula is the "only place on the earth" where a war may break out easily any time and a "place like a powder keg", raising a hue and cry over someone's "provocation". He requested GIs to keep themselves on a full combat alert that a fight may start tonight.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 The U.S. military boss talked rubbish about "powder keg" and the like as if he were interested in peace and stability but the U.S. can never evade the blame for escalating tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are the disturber of peace as they have always escalated the tension on the peninsula.
					
					 It was none other than the U.S. which ignited the Korean War and reduced the Korean Armistice Agreement to a dead paper.
					
					 It is the arch criminal who brought the danger of a nuclear war to the peninsula.
					
					 It goes without saying that the U.S. is driving the situation on the peninsula into the worst phase in a bid to realize its ambition for invading the DPRK and, furthermore, create conditions in favor of carrying out its strategy for dominating the world.
					
					 Had the DPRK not taken toughest counter-action against the U.S. nuclear war racket with war deterrent, the Korean Peninsula would have already turned into a sea of flames.
					
					 Whoever wants global peace and security should clearly see who loves peace and who seeks war on the peninsula.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Military Authorities for Military Confrontation Rackets
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Military Authorities for Military Confrontation Rackets 
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean military authorities staged a confrontation racket under the signboard of "reenactment of Inchon landing operation" on Wolmi Island from September 12. Meanwhile, the warmongers are mulling importing more than 10 sea-patrol planes from the U.S. to "cope with north's submarine infiltration." 
					 These are very dangerous military provocations to scuttle the hard-won phase of detente and escalate the tension on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme pitch once again, Minju Joson Wednesday says in a commentary. It goes on:
					
					 It admits of no argument that the war drumbeats made by them at a time when there is a substantial move for improvement of the north-south relations are not helpful to defusing the tension on the peninsula and improving the inter-Korean relations but are harmful to them. 
					
					 The improvement of the north-south relations and military provocations can never go together. 
					
					 The reality goes to prove that if the south Korean authorities do not  stop the military confrontation rackets, big obstacles, paying lip-service to "dialogue" and "cooperation" as now, the joint press release will be reduced to an empty paper and a grave phase of confrontation be brought to the north-south relations again. 
					
					 Now that a climate for improving the relations has been created in the wake of the north-south high-level urgent contact and the publication of the joint press release, what is important at present is to respect the spirit of the north-south agreement and refrain from any provocative behavior rattling the nerves of the dialogue partner, obstructive to its implementation.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Demand Stop to Retrogressive Revision of Labor Market Structure
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Demand Stop to Retrogressive Revision of Labor Market Structure
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- South Korean workers in the public field of south Korea including those of the public transport trade union, public health and medical service trade union and financial trade union held a rally in Seoul on Sept. 12 in protest against the authorities' moves for the retrogressive revision of the labor market structure.
					 They accused the present regime of unilaterally pressing for the retrogressive revision aimed at easy lay-off, cut-down of wages and expansion of part-time jobs.
					
					 They urged the need to reform big businesses before the reform of the labor market structure, saying the diversion of even some of fund possessed by the big businesses at present will create lots of jobs.
					
					 If the big businesses and the "government" continue to move to retrogressively reform the labor market, workers will launch a general strike against them, they warned.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Calls for Action against Retrogressive Revision of Labor Market
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Calls for Action against Retrogressive Revision of Labor Market 
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The Progressive Solidarity of south Korea in a statement on Monday declared it would launch an action against the retrogressive revision of labor market. 
					 The statement said the regime agreed on the bill on revision of labor market aimed at easier lay-off, low wages and more part-time job system at "Labor-Management-Government Committee" in the absence of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions. 
					
					 The statement bitterly denounced the present regime which threatened and deceived people in order to table the bill at the "National Assembly."
					
					 The statement stressed that the organization together with workers would vigorously stage the struggle against the retrogressive revision of the bill.

articles.title: Meeting of Korean Mothers in Japan Calls for Bringing Bright Future to Children
articles.content:
Meeting of Korean Mothers in Japan Calls for Bringing Bright Future to Children
						
 Tokyo, September 15 (KNS-KCNA) -- The 10th meeting of mothers of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) took place at the Osaka Korean Cultural Hall on Sept. 12.
					 Present there were Kang Chu Ryon, vice-chairwoman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon who is also chairwoman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, Song Kun Hak, director of the Educational Department of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, chairpersons of Chongryon headquarters, principals of Korean schools, officials of the women's union headquarters and those in charge of work with Korean children of their chapters and others. 
					
					 They watched a video "Looking back on days of mothers' meeting".
					
					 Kang Chu Ryon in her speech said that the meetings of Korean mothers in Japan that had regularly been held since its first meeting in Niigata in 1962 have provided an opportunity of bringing about big progress in preserving the national identity of the Korean community, helping mothers fulfill their mission and role and bringing up children and upholding and developing national education.
					
					 She called on the women's union organizations and mothers to work together for the bright future and happiness of children, true to the noble intention of the great leaders in the new century, too.
					
					 Representatives of Tokyo, Nishi Tokyo, Gunma, Aichi, Hyogo, Shiga, Okayama and Fukuoka talked about achievements and experience gained in education of children and the work of mothers' society of schools and the work of the "Society of Mums and Children".
					
					 An action program demanding the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan accept the application of aid system for Korean schools and a plan for organizing demonstrations of Korean women winning the right to national education were released.
					
					 An appeal was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced by British Organization
Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on September 8 posted on its homepage the gist of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Accomplish the Cause of Socialism and Communism under the Revolutionary Banner of Juche".

articles.title: Syrian Personage Supports Korean People's Just Cause
articles.content:
Syrian Personage Supports Korean People's Just Cause
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Saber Ballul, department head of the Political Faculty of Damascus University of Syria, released a statement on September 8 on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 He said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK, genuine people's country for the first time in the history of the Korean nation spanning 5 000 years, on September 9, 1948.
					
					 The founding of the DPRK marked a historic event as it brought about a fundamental turn in hewing out the destiny of the Korean people.
					
					 Since then the Korean people, once exploited and oppressed, appeared masters of the country.
					
					 The DPRK was founded on the basis of the Juche idea of Kim Il Sung that popular masses are the masters of the revolution and construction and they are capable of promoting the revolution and construction.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il developed in depth this great Juche idea as a guiding idea of the era.
					
					 The DPRK has achieved great successes and prosperity in all fields including politics, economy and culture, guided by the Juche idea and made dynamic progress despite storm and stress when the eastern European socialist countries collapsed late in the last century.
					
					 I am sure that the heroic Korean people will win a brilliant victory in the struggle for building a thriving nation and achieving national reunification without fail under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats for Nation-building Praised in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats for Nation-building Praised in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- A political party and organizations of different countries posted special write-ups on their websites on Sept. 4 and 7 on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Socialist Party of Romania posted on its website an article titled "Founder of the DPRK."
					
					 The article said that President Kim Il Sung explored the road of building people's power from an independent stand, not wedded to the established theory or experience of other countries, with his noble desire to build people's country in his early years.
					
					 It noted that the President founded the DPRK, the first people's democratic state in the East, on Sept. 9, 1948 after the liberation of Korea on the basis of the historic experience gained in establishing a people's revolutionary government in the guerrilla base during the anti-Japanese armed struggle and wisely led the country and its people as its top leader for a long period.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK posted an article illustrated with a portrait of the smiling President. 
					
					 The article said that the DPRK's history of development shining as a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence would be unthinkable apart from his nation-building exploits.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in an article titled "People's country" cited facts to prove that all members of the society in the DPRK are fully guaranteed political freedom and rights.

articles.title: DPRK Lauded in Russia, Poland
articles.content:
DPRK Lauded in Russia, Poland
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Articles praising the might of the DPRK were posted on websites of Russia and Poland on Sept. 8 on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 An article titled "The DPRK today" posted on the website Irkutsk of Russia said:
					
					 The DPRK is the country strong in independence.
					
					 This was clearly proved by what happened after the successful launch of the satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2.
					
					 When the U.S. and its followers prodded the UNSC into adopting a "resolution on sanctions," groundlessly pulling up the DPRK over its satellite launch for peaceful purposes, it categorically rejected this and conducted the third underground nuclear test as part of its countermeasure for self-defence.
					
					 The DPRK, not a big country, demonstrated before the whole world its sovereignty and dignity, firmly standing against the U.S. styling itself "the world's only superpower" and its followers. Through this eye-opening reality the international community keenly realized that the DPRK is, indeed, a country strong in independence which no one dares to provoke.
					
					 The Polish website The DPRK in an article accompanied by a photo of President Kim Il Sung introduced the road of victory and glory covered by the DPRK.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to DPRK Missions in Different Countries
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Missions in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Political parties, ministries, organizations, institutions and personages of different countries sent floral baskets and bouquets to the DPRK missions in their countries from Sept. 3 to 9 in celebration of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They included the Commission of the External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, the Foreign Ministry, the Defense Ministry, the Ministry of Public Security, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development, the Union of Friendship Organizations, the Ho Chi Minh Museum and the Academy of Social Science, the Laos-Korea Friendship Association, the General Bureau of Security of the Ministry of Security of Laos, the Central Committee of the Lao Women's Union, the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Youth Union, the Senate of Cambodia, the Central Committee of the People's Party and the Khmer Democratic Party of Cambodia, the Foreign Ministry of Myanmar, the Chamber of Commerce and Industry and the International Commerce Promotion Center of Myanmar, the Islamic Coalition Party of Iran, the Islamic Revolutionary Proletarian Organization of Iran and the Workers' Home of Iran, the Indian National Congress Party, the Communist Party of India (Marxist), the All-India Forward Bloc, the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association, the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia, the Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea and the Taekwon-Do Federation of the Czech Republic, the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, the Democratic Party and government of Equatorial Guinea, the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, the deputy prime minister of Laos who is also foreign minister, the Iranian foreign minister, the deputy speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia, the chairman of the National Leading Council of the Diversity Party of Indonesia, the speaker of the National Assembly of Cambodia, the deputy prime minister of Cambodia who is also minister of Interior, the minister of Information of Cambodia, the mayor of Phnom Penh, the president of the Socialist Party of Benin.
					
					 The floral baskets and bouquets were placed before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and full-length paintings depicting them standing together.

articles.title: DPRK Introduced by Vietnamese Papers
articles.content:
DPRK Introduced by Vietnamese Papers
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese newspapers carried articles introducing the DPRK illustrated with photos on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The August issue of a Vietnamese paper dedicated its two whole pages to an article titled "Realities of the DPRK" accompanied with the photos introducing the true picture of the DPRK. It is also illustrated with photos of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper said in its preface:
					
					 The DPRK is the country like an oasis today. The western media always paint a gloomy picture of the DPRK. Not a few media are releasing biased news about the politics, economy, society and culture of the DPRK. But the life of the Korean people is still in very good shape.
					
					 Another Vietnam paper Quan Doi Nhan Dan on September 9 carried an article introducing Pyongyang International Airport illustrated with a photo showing a panoramic view of the terminal.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al presidente mexicano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al presidente mexicano 
						
Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio este miercoles un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de los Estados Unidos Mexicanos, Enrique Pena Nieto, con motivo del 205o aniversario de la independencia de este pais.
					El remitente desea al mandatario y a su pueblo mayores exitos en las labores para la estabilidad y el desarrollo del pais y expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises se ampliaran y se desarrollaran.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju estudia labores del dominio industrial de la zona de Hungnam
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju estudia labores del dominio industrial de la zona de Hungnam
						
Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, averiguo en el terreno las labores del dominio industrial en la zona de Hungnam.
					El premier recorrio el Complejo de Fertilizantes de Hungnam, el Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong y la Fabrica de Electrodo de Hungnam cerciorandose de los detalles de la situacion productiva. 
					
					Tuvieron lugar las reuniones consultivas de los funcionarios de las ramas interesadas en las respectivas unidades, en las cuales fueron discutidos los problemas para definir correctamente el periodo de reparacion de los equipos y reducir su periodo para asegurar la produccion de abonos del ano de fertilizacion, garantizar las caracteristicas tecnicas de los equipos encargados y elevar la tenacidad del electrodo.
					
					Ademas, tomaron medidas para instalar el proceso de clasificacion de carbon en las minas carboniferas vinculadas con las unidades arriba mencionadas, concentrar las manos de obra a la evacuacion del esteril y aumentar la produccion de materias primas de electrodo.
					
					Por otra parte, Pak visito la sucursal de Hamhung de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias y el Complejo de Vinalon "8 de Febrero", donde consulto los temas para normalizar la produccion de vinalon.

articles.title: Adoptado en RPDC reglamento tributario de zona de desarrollo economico
articles.content:
Adoptado en RPDC reglamento tributario de zona de desarrollo economico
						
Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo aprobado el reglamento tributario de la zona de desarrollo economico segun el decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema.
					El reglamento consta de 11 capitulos y 72 articulos.
					
					El reglamento aclara el deber de pago, el objeto sujeto a impuesto, la tarifa, la manera de calculacion y los objetos de reduccion y extincion segun la clase tributaria tales como los impuestos por ingresos empresariales e individuales, las entradas de transaccion y el impuesto de negocio.
					
					El reglamento contribuye a observar correctamente la imposicion y el pago de impuesto al establecer estrictamente los ordenes de asuntos tributarios en la zona de desarrollo economico.
